result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Jail (Straight Time).
Credit For Time Served 15 Days.

miscConds.notes:
Court Costs paid In Full. DNA Surcharge cash bail applied and the remaining surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $500 per month starting 09-01-2015.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Be involved in a 12 step program 2 times per week commencing within 30 days and obtain a mentor/sponsor within 60 days.
Complete a Cognitive Thinking Course.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Maintain a valid driver's license
No contact with Tammy M.  Agent can evaluate after 6 months.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Case #14CM2247 was Dismissed and Read into Cases:  #15CF693, #14CM1646 and #15CM510.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  30 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - Defendant to report to Huber by 06:00 pm on 06-15-2015.

Attorney Kershek requests bail be modified.  Attorney Dewire objects to a modification of bail.  The Court granted the Motion to Modify Bail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with victim or her residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.    Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Daniel R Gardner in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek who appears as a friend of the court.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Kershek states  the assigned DA to the cases is not in so he was unable to obtain a global offer.  Atty. Kershek requests a plea and sentencing or new trial date be set.    PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS
  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
